benchmark_details.name: Open-LLM-Leaderboard
benchmark_details.overview: This work aims to tackle the difficulties of evaluating large language models (LLMs) through entirely open-style questions, establishing a new benchmark to reflect their true capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To refine the assessment process of large language models using open-style questions and eliminate issues found in multiple-choice questions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The performance metrics used may not fully capture the nuanced capabilities of each model.

data.source: Evaluated from multiple datasets including MMLU, ARC, HellaSwag, WinoGrande, PIQA, CommonsenseQA, Race, MedMCQA, and OpenbookQA.
data.size: 42,000 questions evaluated, 23,839 suitable for open-style answering
data.annotation: Automatically annotated for suitability as open-style questions

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is derived based on comparison of model-generated responses to a validated ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: A significant drop in accuracy was observed for open-style questions compared to multiple-choice questions, with an average reduction of about 25%.
methodology.validation: The automatic evaluation strategy was validated against human checks with an error rate of less than 5%.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User privacy concerns are minimal since the benchmark utilizes public datasets and questions.
